rules.natural: Should the restaurant have a permit, then it does not serve food.
In the event that the inspector checks the stall, then if it is not the case that lacking a valid license implies authorization would lead to a warning, the vendor gets a penalty.
Either the inspector checks the stall or the manager reviews the stall.
Should the manager review the stall, then if it is not the case that lacking a license implies authorization would result in a warning, the vendor gets a penalty.
Whenever the vendor operates legally, then the vendor is authorized.
Under the condition that the vendor pays fees, the vendor operates legally.
Either the vendor pays fees or the vendor has an exemption.
Either the customer has a complaint or, if the vendor has an exemption, the vendor operates legally.
The customer makes a report or the customer does not have a complaint.
The customer submits feedback or the customer does not make a report.
Either the item is food available or the vendor is authorized.
When a promotion runs for the event, then either there is a special offer for the item or, provided that the item is food available, it can be ordered.
Either a promotion runs for the event or the event has a seasonal sale.
Under the condition that the event has a seasonal sale, then either there is a special offer for the item or, if the item is food available, it can be ordered.
Either a violation is found at the restaurant or there is a compliance issue at the restaurant.
Provided that there is a compliance issue at the restaurant, then the restaurant does not have a permit.
Should an audit be conducted at the restaurant, then if a violation is found, the restaurant does not have a permit.
Either an audit is conducted at the restaurant or an inspection is done at the restaurant.
If the restaurant applies for a permit, then, provided that it has a permit, it serves food.
In the event that a fine is issued to the vendor, then a warning is issued to the vendor.
Under the condition that enforcement action is taken against the vendor, then if it is not the case that inspection done implies violation found leads to no permit, a fine is issued to the vendor.
Either the customer's complaint is resolved or the customer does not make a report.
Should the customer receive a refund, then the customer's complaint is not resolved.
Provided that the customer gets compensation, then the customer is satisfied.
In the event that the manager intervenes in the issue, then if the customer receives an apology, the customer gets compensation.
Either the manager intervenes in the issue or the owner resolves the issue.
Under the condition that the restaurant renews its permit, then, should it have a permit, it serves food.
Should the owner resolve the issue, then if the customer receives an apology, the customer gets compensation.
When a discount is available for the item, then either there is a special offer for the item or, provided that the item is food available, it can be ordered.
If the price is reduced for the item, then the item is not at full price.
Either the price is reduced for the item or the item is on clearance sale.
Provided that the item is on clearance sale, then the item is not at full price.
Should the restaurant submit an application, then the restaurant applies for a permit.
In the event that the restaurant files a renewal, then the restaurant renews its permit.
Under the condition that the restaurant completes forms, then the restaurant submits an application.
Whenever the restaurant updates documents, then the restaurant files a renewal.
Should the restaurant initiate a process, then either it completes forms or it updates documents.
Should it not be the case that lacking a refund implies no voucher, then the customer receives an apology.
In the event that it is not the case that not receiving a refund implies not getting a voucher, then the customer is not satisfied.
If the customer does not receive a refund, then the customer gets a voucher.
Whenever a discount is not available for the item, then the item is at full price.
Provided that the vendor is not authorized, then the restaurant has a permit.

facts.natural: An enforcement action is taken against the vendor.
The vendor does not get a warning.
The vendor does not get a penalty.
The customer does not submit feedback.
There is no special offer for the item.
A warning is not issued to the vendor.

(A1 → A2).natural: If the restaurant has a permit, then it serves food.

(A1 → ¬A2).natural: Should the restaurant have a permit, then it does not serve food.

(A10 → G).natural: Provided that the vendor has a license, it follows that the vendor is authorized.

(A13 → (¬(¬(A10 → G) → A11) → A12)).natural: In the event that the inspector checks the stall, then if it is not the case that lacking a valid license implies authorization would lead to a warning, the vendor gets a penalty.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either the inspector checks the stall or the manager reviews the stall.

(A14 → (¬(¬(A10 → G) → A11) → A12)).natural: Should the manager review the stall, then if it is not the case that lacking a license implies authorization would result in a warning, the vendor gets a penalty.

(A15 → G).natural: Whenever the vendor operates legally, then the vendor is authorized.

(A16 → A15).natural: Under the condition that the vendor pays fees, the vendor operates legally.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Either the vendor pays fees or the vendor has an exemption.

(A17 → A15).natural: Provided that the vendor has an exemption, then the vendor operates legally.

(A18 ∨ (A17 → A15)).natural: Either the customer has a complaint or, if the vendor has an exemption, the vendor operates legally.

(A19 ∨ ¬A18).natural: The customer makes a report or the customer does not have a complaint.

(A20 ∨ ¬A19).natural: The customer submits feedback or the customer does not make a report.

(A21 → A22).natural: If the item is food available, then it can be ordered.

(A21 ∨ G).natural: Either the item is food available or the vendor is authorized.

(A23 ∨ (A21 → A22)).natural: There is a special offer for the item or, if the item is food available, then it can be ordered.

(A24 → (A23 ∨ (A21 → A22))).natural: When a promotion runs for the event, then either there is a special offer for the item or, provided that the item is food available, it can be ordered.

(A24 ∨ A25).natural: Either a promotion runs for the event or the event has a seasonal sale.

(A25 → (A23 ∨ (A21 → A22))).natural: Under the condition that the event has a seasonal sale, then either there is a special offer for the item or, if the item is food available, it can be ordered.

(A26 → ¬A1).natural: In the event that a violation is found at the restaurant, then the restaurant does not have a permit.

(A26 ∨ A27).natural: Either a violation is found at the restaurant or there is a compliance issue at the restaurant.

(A27 → ¬A1).natural: Provided that there is a compliance issue at the restaurant, then the restaurant does not have a permit.

(A28 → (A26 → ¬A1)).natural: Should an audit be conducted at the restaurant, then if a violation is found, the restaurant does not have a permit.

(A28 ∨ A29).natural: Either an audit is conducted at the restaurant or an inspection is done at the restaurant.

(A29 → (A26 → ¬A1)).natural: Whenever an inspection is done at the restaurant, then if a violation is found, the restaurant does not have a permit.

(A3 → (A1 → A2)).natural: If the restaurant applies for a permit, then, provided that it has a permit, it serves food.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Either the restaurant applies for a permit or the restaurant renews its permit.

(A31 → A30).natural: In the event that a fine is issued to the vendor, then a warning is issued to the vendor.

(A32 → (¬(A29 → (A26 → ¬A1)) → A31)).natural: Under the condition that enforcement action is taken against the vendor, then if it is not the case that inspection done implies violation found leads to no permit, a fine is issued to the vendor.

(A33 ∨ ¬A19).natural: Either the customer's complaint is resolved or the customer does not make a report.

(A34 → ¬A33).natural: Should the customer receive a refund, then the customer's complaint is not resolved.

(A37 → A36).natural: If the customer receives an apology, then the customer is satisfied.

(A37 → A38).natural: Whenever the customer receives an apology, then the customer gets compensation.

(A38 → A36).natural: Provided that the customer gets compensation, then the customer is satisfied.

(A39 → (A37 → A38)).natural: In the event that the manager intervenes in the issue, then if the customer receives an apology, the customer gets compensation.

(A39 ∨ A40).natural: Either the manager intervenes in the issue or the owner resolves the issue.

(A4 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Under the condition that the restaurant renews its permit, then, should it have a permit, it serves food.

(A40 → (A37 → A38)).natural: Should the owner resolve the issue, then if the customer receives an apology, the customer gets compensation.

(A41 → (A23 ∨ (A21 → A22))).natural: When a discount is available for the item, then either there is a special offer for the item or, provided that the item is food available, it can be ordered.

(A43 → ¬A42).natural: If the price is reduced for the item, then the item is not at full price.

(A43 ∨ A44).natural: Either the price is reduced for the item or the item is on clearance sale.

(A44 → ¬A42).natural: Provided that the item is on clearance sale, then the item is not at full price.

(A5 → A3).natural: Should the restaurant submit an application, then the restaurant applies for a permit.

(A5 ∨ A6).natural: Either the restaurant submits an application or the restaurant files a renewal.

(A6 → A4).natural: In the event that the restaurant files a renewal, then the restaurant renews its permit.

(A7 → A5).natural: Under the condition that the restaurant completes forms, then the restaurant submits an application.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Either the restaurant completes forms or the restaurant updates documents.

(A8 → A6).natural: Whenever the restaurant updates documents, then the restaurant files a renewal.

(A9 → (A7 ∨ A8)).natural: Should the restaurant initiate a process, then either it completes forms or it updates documents.

(¬(A10 → G) → A11).natural: If it is not the case that having a license implies authorization, then the vendor gets a warning.

(¬(A29 → (A26 → ¬A1)) → A30).natural: In the event that it is not the case that inspection done implies violation found leads to no permit, then a warning is issued to the vendor.

(¬(A29 → (A26 → ¬A1)) → A31).natural: Provided that it is not the case that inspection done implies violation found leads to no permit, then a fine is issued to the vendor.

(¬(¬(A10 → G) → A11) → A12).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that lacking license implies authorization not leading to a warning, then the vendor gets a penalty.

(¬(¬A34 → ¬A35) → A36).natural: If it is not the case that not receiving a refund implies not getting a voucher, then the customer is satisfied.

(¬(¬A34 → ¬A35) → A37).natural: Should it not be the case that lacking a refund implies no voucher, then the customer receives an apology.

(¬(¬A34 → ¬A35) → ¬A36).natural: In the event that it is not the case that not receiving a refund implies not getting a voucher, then the customer is not satisfied.

(¬A34 → A35).natural: If the customer does not receive a refund, then the customer gets a voucher.

(¬A34 → ¬A35).natural: Under the condition that the customer does not receive a refund, then the customer does not get a voucher.

(¬A41 → A42).natural: Whenever a discount is not available for the item, then the item is at full price.

(¬G → A1).natural: Provided that the vendor is not authorized, then the restaurant has a permit.

A32.natural: An enforcement action is taken against the vendor.

A41.natural: A discount is available for the item.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the restaurant has a permit.
